intro: Rhexia virginica var. purshii, commonly known as Pursh's redroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas and wetlands. It has opposite, hairy leaves and produces small, dark berries that contain the seeds. This variety is often found in the southeastern United States, including parts of Georgia and Tennessee.
